subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Checks that a specified pattern matches a single-line in Java files.
subsection.p: This class is variation on RegexpSingleline for detecting single-lines that match a supplied regular expression in Java files. It supports suppressing matches in Java comments.

tr.td: Specify the format of the regular expression to match.
Control whether to ignore case when searching.
Control whether to ignore text in comments when searching.
Specify the maximum number of matches required in each file.
Specify the message which is used to notify about violations, if empty then default (hard-coded) message is used.
Specify the minimum number of matches required in each file.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check for calls to System.out.println, except in comments:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <!-- . matches any character, so we need to escape it and use \. to match dots. --> <property name="format" value="System\.out\.println"/> <property name="ignoreComments" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to find case-insensitive occurrences of "debug":

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <property name="format" value="debug"/> <property name="ignoreCase" value="true"/> <property name="ignoreComments" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to find occurrences of "\.read(.*)|\.write(.*)" and display "IO found" for each violation.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <property name="format" value="\.read(.*)|\.write(.*)"/> <property name="message" value="IO found"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to find occurrences of "\.log(.*)". We want to allow a maximum of 2 occurrences.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <property name="format" value="\.info(.*)"/> <property name="maximum" value="2"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to find all occurrences of "public". We want to ignore comments, display "public member found" for each violation and say if less than 1 occurrences.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <property name="format" value="public"/> <property name="minimum" value="1"/> <property name="message" value="public member found"/> <property name="ignoreComments" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to find all occurrences of "private". We want to ignore comments, display "private member found" for each violation and say if less than 2 occurrences.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <property name="format" value="private"/> <property name="minimum" value="2"/> <property name="message" value="private member found"/> <property name="ignoreComments" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
